+++
title = "Local Councillor Reconsiders Controversial Child-Rearing Comment"
date = "2026-02-08"
author = "Sarah Jenkins, Chief Reporter"
categories = ["Community"]
tags = ["Hastings","Rye","Education","Council"]
draft = false
+++

In a recent turn of events, Jan Leeming, a local councillor for Hastings and Rye, has retracted her previous controversial statement regarding child-rearing methods. During an interview with Kent Online, Ms. Leeming issued a public apology and clarified that her initial comment was not intended to demean or undermine the role of parents in raising their children.

The original comment sparked significant debate within the community, prompting local residents to voice their concerns about the implications for child welfare and education policies. In response, Councillor Leeming emphasized the importance of fostering a supportive environment that respects parental rights while advocating for responsible caregiving practices.

Ms. Leeming's retraction highlights the ongoing dialogue around effective parenting strategies and community support systems in Hastings and Rye. The local council is now set to review existing initiatives aimed at supporting families, ensuring they align with best practices and address the evolving needs of the community.

---
